title: Vitex Extract | Integrative Therapeutics®
description: Provides support during premenstrual and menstrual cycles.*
cleaned_text: in](/account?locale=en) [View full details](/products/vitex-extract) Product information HELPS PROVIDE SUPPORT DURING PREMENSTRUAL AND MENSTRUAL CYCLES* Vitex Extract is unique because each capsule is standardized to provide 0.5% agnuside, chaste berry's most significant compound. Chaste tree berry extract is a source of phytoestrogens and a popular herb among women who need support during premenstrual and menstrual cycles.* Vitex Extract is particularly beneficial for premenstrual syndrome.* HELPS PROVIDE SUPPORT DURING PREMENSTRUAL AND MENSTRUAL CYCLES* Vitex Extract is unique because each capsule is standardized to provide 0.5% agnuside, chaste berry's most significant compound. Chaste tree berry extract is a source of phytoestrogens and a popular herb among women who need support during premenstrual and menstrual cycles.* Vitex Extract is particularly beneficial for premenstrual syndrome.* INGREDIENTS 225mg Chaste Tree (Vitex agnus-castus) Berry Extract standardized to contain 0.5% agnusides ** Daily Value (DV) not established Percent daily value is based on a 2000 calorie diet Other Ingredients Vitex Extract Does Not Contain Wheat Gluten Soy Dairy Colors Artificial Flavors Other Details UPC: 871791002234 SKU: 78726 DIRECTIONS Vitex Extract Directions and/or DosageAdults take 1 capsule twice daily, or as recommended by a healthcare professional. WarningIf you are pregnant, nursing, or taking any medications, consult a healthcare professional before use. Keep out of reach of children. Safety sealed with inner seal. Do not use if seal is broken or missing. Keep tightly closed. Store at room temperature. Avoid excessive heat and direct sunlight. INTERACTIONS FAQS A: Vitex Extract was designed to support women experiencing premenstrual and menstrual cycle symptoms.* Vitex Extract is highly effective in reducing PMS symptoms and modulating hormone balance, specifically progesterone balance.* A: No. Based on a review of the established resources, including the American Botanical Council Clinical Guide to Herbs, chaste tree contains no direct estrogen-like components and possesses not estrogenic effects in the body.
